title: Russian Officials Flee Kherson as Russian Troops Dig In for a Battle
description: In Kherson, the first Ukrainian city to fall after the Russian invasion, occupation forces appear to be preparing to fight advancing Ukrainian troops.

title: Sunak’s Ascent Is a Breakthrough for Diversity, With Privilege
description: Rishi Sunak’s ascent to the prime minister’s office is a significant milestone for Britain’s Indian diaspora. But for many, his immense personal wealth has made him less relatable.

title: Rishi Sunak Wins Contest to be UK’s Next PM and Confront Economic Storm
description: After a period of chaos, Mr. Sunak, a Conservative, faces serious political and economic headwinds. He will be the first person of color and first Hindu to be prime minister.

title: What Will Rishi Sunak Do as UK’s Prime Minister?
description: He has said very little about how he will turn around Britain’s economy or deal with any of the other issues facing the U.K.

title: How Rich Is Rishi Sunak, Britain’s Incoming Prime Minister?
description: Just how rich is the soon-to-be prime minister of Britain?

title: Venezuelan Migrants Stranded After US Border Policy Change
description: They have sold their belongings and trekked across a deadly jungle. Now, tens of thousands Venezuelan migrants are stranded south of the United States, with nowhere to go.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Rishi Sunak to Lead Britain
description: Plus Chinese markets react to a stronger Xi Jinping and young Chinese pursue quiet dissent.

title: South African Leader Unveils Anticorruption Plans, but Doubts Follow
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa presented measures that would place even himself and his cabinet under scrutiny. But some analysts question whether the plan will be carried out.

title: Brittney Griner Doesn’t Expect ‘Miracles to Happen’ With Her Appeal
description: If the appeals court won’t overrule Ms. Griner’s verdict, it will come into force and she will be sent to a penal colony.

title: Where Russians Retreated, Ukrainians Find Devastation
description: Returning to liberated towns, Ukrainians find destruction on a staggering scale, vital services cut, and the prospect of a lethal winter ahead.

title: For Ukrainian Runners, a Brutal Race Made Sense When Little Else Did
description: Backyard ultramarathons are grueling, hourslong races. The international team competition, held on Oct. 15, included runners from dozens of nations racing on their home turf, including Ukraine.

title: Rishi Sunak Will Face Difficult Economic Tests Immediately
description: As prime minister, Mr. Sunak will face a vastly different economic backdrop to the one he experienced as finance minister.

title: Rishi Sunak will face difficult economic tests immediately.
description: As prime minister, Mr. Sunak will face a vastly different economic backdrop to the one he experienced as finance minister.

title: Ethiopian Government and Tigray Rebels Are Set to Begin Peace Talks
description: Delegations from both sides have traveled to South Africa for the first formal negotiations since the civil war erupted nearly two years ago.

title: Western Allies Reject Russia’s ‘Dirty Bomb’ Claims
description: Diplomats from France, Britain and the United States called Russia’s allegation a pretext that Moscow has concocted for escalating the war.

title: What Will Happen Next to Become U.K. Prime Minister?
description: Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak must now visit Buckingham Palace to meet with King Charles III, who will invite Mr. Sunak to form the next government.

title: Rishi Sunak Makes History as Britain’s First Prime Minister of Color
description: Born in southern England to parents of Indian heritage, he has spoken of a childhood split between the Hindu temple and cheering on the local soccer team.

title: Sunak was the clear front-runner.
Meloni Government in Italy Promises to Keep Backing Ukraine
description: Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani expressed support for Ukraine, trying to dispel concerns that Italy could undercut Europe’s opposition to the Russian invasion.

title: A Republican Advantage
description: As headlines shift in the weeks before the midterms, so do voters’ top concerns.

title: Who Are the Top 2 Contenders for Next U.K. Prime Minister?
description: The race has come down to two candidates: Rishi Sunak and Penny Mordaunt.

title: How to Watch the Partial Solar Eclipse This Week
description: The event will be visible from Europe, northern Africa, the Middle East and Asia on Tuesday.

title: Brazil’s Polls Were Wrong. Now the Right Wants to Criminalize Them.
description: President Jair Bolsonaro and conservative lawmakers in Brazil are trying to make it illegal to publish polls that later do not match the election results.

title: U.K. Live Updates: New Prime Minister Could Be Named Today
description: Candidates were vying for the support of Conservative lawmakers after Liz Truss resigned last week amid economic turmoil. Rishi Sunak, the former chancellor of the Exchequer, was the front-runner.

title: Ukraine’s Top Allies Warn Russia About ‘Dirty Bomb’ Claims
description: In a rare joint statement, the U.S., Britain and France said they had spoken to Russian officials and urged Moscow not to risk escalating the war with talk of nuclear weapons.

title: As Israel Votes, Again, Netanyahu Pins Hopes on the Far Right
description: To regain power, Benjamin Netanyahu, the longest-serving Israeli prime minister, will most likely need the support of Itamar Ben-Gvir, a far-right leader with a history of extreme views.

title: U.S. Executives Are Flocking to Saudi Davos in the Desert
description: Some top American business leaders area headed to the Saudi business conference. But Biden administration officials, angry over the kingdom’s stance on oil production and ties with Russia, are staying away.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Britain’s leadership race.

title: Climate Activists Throw Mashed Potatoes on Monet Painting
description: The stunt in a German museum was the latest attack on widely admired art, carried out by protesters demanding action on climate change.
